required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: KOMATE Registry: Korean Multicenter Angioplasty Team
clinical_study.official_title: KOMATE Registry: Korean Multicenter Angioplasty Team

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators will enroll the patients who underwent PCI and was based on real world clinical practice to collect the data regarding demographic, clinical, procedural information and clinical outcome using case report forms.

primary_outcome.description: Stent thrombosis is defined and discussed by the Academic Research Consortium
Myocardial Infarction Classification and Criteria for Diagnosis is defined by the Academic Research Consortium
All death will be recorded and their reason also be recorded. Also, cardiac death is defined as death due to myocardial infarction, cardiac perforation, tamponade, arrhythmia or any cardiac cause.
Any revascularization of target-vessel revascularization will be collected.

Sudden onset of vertigo, numbness, aphasia, dysarthria or central neurologic deficit secondary to vascular lesions of the brain such as hemorrhage, embolism, thrombosis, or rupturing aneurysm, that persist for > 72 hours.
Any bleeding event will be collected with following description; the amount of hemoglobin drop or transfusion, the site of bleeding, any further treatment for the bleeding.
Any readmission due to cardiovascular adverse event will be collected.

arm_group.arm_group_label: The patients who undergo percutaneous coronary intervention
arm_group.description: The patients who undergo percutaneous coronary intervention will be enrolled.

intervention.description: All coronary intervention procedures will be performed according to current standard techniques.
intervention.arm_group_label: The patients who undergo percutaneous coronary intervention

study_pop.textblock: The patients who undergo percutaneous coronary intervention group/Cohort Description: The patients who undergo percutaneous coronary intervention will be enrolled.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 1. Patients older than 19 years
- 2. Patients who undergo percutaneous coronary intervention
Exclusion Criteria:
- 1. Refuse to participate
- 2. Pregnant women or women with potential childbearing

facility.name: Division of Cardiology, Severance Cardiovascular Hospital Yonsei University College of Medicine, 250 Seongsanno, Seodaemun-gu 120-752 Seoul, South Korea
